content: **helpful notes ** these are the answers to the questions i am asked over and over hopefully this will help for smooth knitting smiley > after you work your ribbing **make > sure you work the set up round ** > > in order to get the swirl you have to > start with an **odd** number of > stitches the setup round will bring > your stitch count to an odd number if > you are not there already > when you begin the twisted stitch > repeats you are going to have 1 > stitch left before the marker you > will **ignore** the marker from here > on out > > if you feel like the marker is going > to be a mental block it can also be > a pain when you have to twist where > the marker is then **use a removable > marker** a row or two down instead and just move it up > a few row at a time until you are > ready to start the crown ----------------- the bewind hat uses a simple twisted stitch pattern to create a lovely winding motif that spirals its way up to the top of the crown if you can work a knit 2 together k2tog then you can knit the twisted stitch beginner friendly choose one skein of your favorite worsted weight yarn and you ll have a new favorite winter hat in no time
